definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: Wang Xueming keen on the idea, so she came to Beijing to complete the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 王学明满口答应，让她来北京办手续。

sentences.english: I readily promised, and say a person to walk not frightened.
sentences.chinese: 我满口答应了，并说一个人走不害怕。

sentences.english: In agreeing so readily, he had an axe to grind.
sentences.chinese: 他满口答应了这件事，是有他自己的算盘的。

sentences.english: To my surprise, he laughed and agreed.
sentences.chinese: 让我没想到的是，他笑了，并满口答应。

sentences.english: Wang gave her a promise and then slept together with her.
sentences.chinese: 王生满口答应，就和她同床共枕。

definition: to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to follow the rules/to do as instructed/to play by the book/to comply with a request
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
see 二話不說|二话不说[er4 hua4 bu4 shuo1]
to promise/to agree to do sth
